Dear Mr. Zolman:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 10/17/23. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899-6024 .
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation
(1)An agency social service worker shall complete a
written adoptive evaluation within 90 days of the family
signing an adoption application and prior to approving a
family for adoption.
One of three adoptive family evaluations was not completed within the required
90-day timeframe.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period. Compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. The CAP,
approved 11/1/22, was a result of the 10/21/22 interim review. The CAP was due
to a citation of rule 327, special investigations. The agency implemented their CAP
shortly after approval. The agency then chose to remove foster care and foster
home licensing from their license types, and only provide adoption services at this
time.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed and discussed on-site. The
Chief Administrator reported they have not encountered any staffing concerns this
year. The agency chose to stop providing foster care and foster home licensing
services and focused on adoption only. Overall, the adoption program is running
smoothly and only had three placement disruptions. The CA reported the
disruptions were similar in that they involved older youth, who had a lengthy
history of residential placement prior to adoptive placement. The agency reported
they believe additional trauma related training would be beneficial to families
considering a youth transitioning from residential to an adoptive home. In addition,
they believe the agency with the child's case responsibility could provide useful
training to potential adoptive parents, about the specific issues related to the
child's trauma history and transitioning to an adoptive home.
Financial Overview
No financial concerns were noted.
Staff and Youth Interviews
One adoption worker was interviewed. The adoption worker reported enjoying her
job and having a great relationship with her supervisor. She stated she can go to
her supervisor with any questions or concerns and feels respected. She reported
having no concerns or suggestions for improvement.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency continues to be located in the same building as the 2022 review. The
office continues to have adequate space for staff and clients, and sufficient
storage for confidential information.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Not applicable- This program is adoption only.

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
